alert.note: Alert for Hockley; Lubbock (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 24 at 7:14PM CDT until May 24 at 8:30PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 830 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR SOUTHEASTERN HOCKLEY AND SOUTHERN LUBBOCK COUNTIES... At 714 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that the heavy rain had moved out of the warned area. However, between 1.5 and 3.5 inches of rain have fallen and dangerous runoff will continue. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.2 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is already occurring. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Law enforcement reported. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Lubbock, Wolfforth, Ransom Canyon, Woodrow, Slide, and Buffalo Springs. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
